titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Virginia Nelson Speiden Carper Collection on New York University Summer School MC.264
titlestmt.author: Rachel Searcy

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-12-14 08:44:21 -0500.

did.unittitle: Virginia Nelson Speiden Carper Collection on New York University Summer School
did.abstract: Virginia Nelson Speiden Carper (1908-2005) was from Manassas, Virginia and the daughter of architect Albert Speiden. In 1931 she attended New York University Summer School to study music education. This collection consists of materials collected by Virginia Nelson Speiden Carper documenting her attendance at NYU in the summer of 1931. Materials in this collection include correspondence regarding classes and accommodations, a lecture outline for a class on music education, a map of New York City, a copy of The Summer School News, a program for "Philadelphia in Music: Past and Present," Pullman Company passenger car fare checks, receipts, and newspaper clippings. The collection also includes documents from Hotel Judson, which hosted summer school students.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of materials collected by Virginia Nelson Speiden Carper documenting her attendance at New York University's Summer School in 1931. Materials in this collection include correspondence regarding classes and accommodations, a lecture outline for a class on music education, a map of New York City, a copy of The Summer School News, a program for "Philadelphia in Music: Past and Present," Pullman Company passenger car fare checks, receipts, and newspaper clippings. The collection also includes documents from Hotel Judson, which hosted summer school students.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Mary Helen Dellinger in May, 2016; the accession associated with this gift is 2019.032.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Virginia Nelson Speiden Carter Collection of Materials on New York University Summer School; MC 264; box number; folder number or item identifier; New York University Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: At the time of accessioning, materials were rehoused in an archival box and folders, and described on the collection-level.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Virginia Nelson Speiden Carper (1908-2005) was from Manassas, Virginia and the daughter of architect Albert Speiden. In 1931 she attended NYU Summer School to study music education.
